intro: Centaurea amberboi, commonly known as the Amberboi thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring sturdy, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by pale blue to purple bracts, creating a striking visual contrast. Centaurea amberboi is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields.
